thread.title: Coffman helps Wyoming snap losing streak, beats Nevada 28-21
thread.title_full: Coffman helps Wyoming snap losing streak, beats Nevada 28-21

title: Coffman helps Wyoming snap losing streak, beats Nevada 28-21
text:
Coffman helps Wyoming snap losing streak, beats Nevada 28-21 - FOX5 Vegas - KVVU Member Center: Coffman helps Wyoming snap losing streak, beats Nevada 28-21 Posted: Updated: 
LARAMIE, Wyo. (AP) - Cam Coffman threw for 213 yards and three touchdowns as Wyoming snapped a nine-game losing streak by beating Nevada 28-21 on Saturday afternoon. 
Brian Hill rushed for 188 yards for Wyoming (1-6, 1-2 Mountain West) while Coffman completed 18 of 20 attempts. It was the Cowboys' first win since beating Fresno State 45-17 on Nov. 1, 2014. 
Tyler Stewart completed 25 of 41 attempts for 287 yards and two TDs for Nevada (3-4, 1-2). His 7-yarder to Jerico Richardson drew the Wolf Pack within 28-21 with 6:36 remaining. 
Nevada forced a Wyoming punt but Stewart was sacked by D.J. May on a 4th-and-5 from the Wyoming 36 with 1:36 remaining. 
Wyoming had gone up 28-7 on a 5-yard run by Kellen Overstreet before Stewart's 12-yard pass to Jerrod Gipson made it 28-14. 
Jacob Hollister, Tanner Gentry and Jake Maulhardt caught TD passes as Wyoming took a 21-7 halftime lead. Copyright 2015 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.
